intro: Quararibea yunckeri subsp. veracruzana, commonly known as the Veracruz mahogany, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal. This species is valued for its hard, durable wood, which has been traditionally used in furniture and construction.
